medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mrs. N reports that her hearing loss has been more bothersome to family members than to herself, spanning 2 to 3 years. Initially, she did not notice significant hearing problems, but acknowledged needing to increase the television volume, often choosing subtitles for better comprehension, and having difficulty understanding speech in group settings. Over time, her husband and daughters have noted that she sometimes misunderstands conversations and often has to ask for clarification.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Varicose veins, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension (both controlled by diet), and recent herpes zoster.
medical_history.social_history: Mrs. N lives with her husband of 49 years in their own home. She previously worked as a private tutor of Spanish and English at a language school and is independent in activities of daily living.
